intro: Gussonia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the silky gussonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock formations. Gussonia lasiocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
